text: In terms of its involvement in proinflammatory response, induction of TNF-α and IL-6 by MHV-A59 infection in primary mouse astrocytes depends on JNK, but not NF-κB or other MAP kinases [75] . The SARS-CoV spike protein also activates the protein kinase C epsilon, which induces JNK phosphorylation in a calcium-independent manner. Moreover, induction of IL-8, activation of CREB and the transcription of cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) gene in cells transfected with SARS-CoV spike also requires JNK [76, 77] .
